sn55.44:1: "Bhikkhus, a noble disciple who possesses four things is said to be rich, with much wealth and property.[n.362] I follow Be and Se in not insertingmahāyasohere. If this is inserted, as in Ee, there is no difference between this sutta and the next one.
sn55.44:2: What four? "Here, bhikkhus, a noble disciple possesses confirmed confidence in the Buddha … in the Dhamma … in the Saṅgha. … He possesses the virtues dear to the noble ones, unbroken … leading to concentration.
